message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.DC, cs.CC 

The paper deals with the challenges faced by Content Providers (CPs) and Internet Service Providers (ISPs) in managing the increasing demand for content and the need for dynamically mapping end-users to appropriate servers. The proposed solution, Content-aware Traffic Engineering (CaTE), utilizes network information and end-user location during the server selection process to improve end-user experience and partially influence traffic demands in ISP networks. This involves aspects of network infrastructure, network security, and distributed computing, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.DC, and cs.CC.
